content:
Wondering if there's an option to disable sending message content in missed message emails, especially for non-public streams and PMs? I searched high and low for something but short of editing the email template I can't find a setting.
If nothing exists maybe I should add an issue here?
Yep, and you may want to cross-link to #5829
interesting. I think it is a reasonable idea, but could you give a few more details about your use case?

my company uses google apps as an internal email server; we do not host our own smtp server; we have a small company so it's not a terribly big deal personally but I suspect other small-ish companies would prefer not to have PM contents be transmitted in emails. I'm mostly using zulip as a richer form of IM, not just open discussion

cool, I hadn't, thanks for the link.
I see, makes sense. That would suggest it should actually be a server setting (similar to how a server admin can turn off push notifications), rather than a user setting.
(probably that's what you meant, I just was thinking about it as a user setting until now :))
oh ya, way more sense as a server setting
